keyTakeAways: At least 46 people were killed in a head-on collision between two buses on the Kampala-Gulu highway near Kiryandongo.
The crash was caused by two buses attempting to overtake a truck and a car from opposite directions, resulting in a head-on collision.
Police initially reported 63 fatalities before revising the toll down to 46 due to misidentification of unconscious victims during rescue efforts.
The Kampala-Gulu Highway is one of Uganda’s busiest routes, linking the capital city with northern Uganda, making it a high-risk corridor for traffic accidents.
Road accidents in Uganda have increased over recent years, with 5,144 deaths reported in 2024, up from 4,806 in 2023 and 4,534 in 2022.
The Red Cross described the scene as extremely gruesome, with victims left with broken limbs and severe injuries, highlighting the human impact of the crash.
The Uganda Police Force is urging motorists to avoid dangerous overtaking, which remains one of the leading causes of crashes in the country.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A major head-on collision on the Kampala-Gulu Highway in Uganda near Kiryandongo resulted in at least 46 deaths, after police initially reported 63. The crash occurred just after midnight on October 22, 2025, when two buses attempting to overtake a truck and car from opposite directions collided. The Uganda Police Force revised the death toll due to misidentification of unconscious victims during rescue efforts. The incident underscores the growing road safety crisis in Uganda, where traffic deaths have risen from 4,534 in 2022 to 5,144 in 2024. Humanitarian organizations like the Red Cross described the scene as extremely gruesome, with victims suffering severe injuries. Authorities are now urging drivers to avoid dangerous overtaking, which remains a leading cause of crashes in the country.
title: Collision on highway in Uganda kills 46 people
